saf.core.ui

Interface IAppConfigurator


  • public interface IAppConfigurator
    Inteface for application configuration. The methods in this interface are called by the SAF application initialization mechanism during points in the applications lifecycle. On application start up, the order in which they are called is:
    1. #preWindowOpen
    2. #createLayout
    3. #fillBars
    4. #postWindowOpen
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $ $Date: 2005/11/21 18:55:17 $
    Author:
    Nick Collier

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createLayout(DockingManager dockingManager)
      Creates the initial layout in the main application window.
      void fillBars(GUIBarManager barManager)
      Optionally adds menu items and actions to the menu and tool bars.
      void postWindowClose()
      Performs some arbitrary clean up type actions immediately prior to closing the main application window.
      void postWindowOpen(ISAFDisplay display)
      Performs some arbitrary actions immediately after the main application window has been open.
      boolean preWindowClose()
      Performs some arbitrary clean up type actions immediately prior to closing the main application window.
      boolean preWindowOpen(IWindowCustomizer customizer)
      Performs some arbitrary actions prior to the main application window opening.

    • Method Detail

      • preWindowOpen

        boolean preWindowOpen(IWindowCustomizer customizer)
        Performs some arbitrary actions prior to the main application window opening. This can be setting the application's look and feel, using the customizer parameter to set the initial window's size, title and so on.
        Parameters:
        customizer - the customizer used to customize the initial application window
        Returns:
        true if the application should continue to open, or false to close stop application initialization. Note that return false can be a normal condition, such as a login failing.

      • fillBars

        void fillBars(GUIBarManager barManager)
        Optionally adds menu items and actions to the menu and tool bars. This can be used to programmatically add tool bar and menus / menu items for those that are not described in an xml plugin file.
        Parameters:
        barManager - the GUIBarManager used to configure tool and menu bars.

      • postWindowOpen

        void postWindowOpen(ISAFDisplay display)
        Performs some arbitrary actions immediately after the main application window has been open.
        Parameters:
        display - the display representing the main application window.

      • preWindowClose

        boolean preWindowClose()
        Performs some arbitrary clean up type actions immediately prior to closing the main application window. Implementors can return false to veto application exit and window close.
        Returns:
        true if the window can continue to close, false to veto the window close.

      • postWindowClose

        void postWindowClose()
        Performs some arbitrary clean up type actions immediately prior to closing the main application window.

      • createLayout

        void createLayout(DockingManager dockingManager)
        Creates the initial layout in the main application window. Typically, implementors would add the initial application views here, setting up the initial gui layout.
        Parameters:
        dockingManager - the ViewManager used to create the initial layout
